description: Ensures all S3 buckets enforce server-side encryption using AES-256 or AWS KMS to protect stored data against unauthorized access.

controlMappings.control: CC6.1 - Logical and Physical Access Controls

requirements: All S3 buckets must have server-side encryption enabled.
Buckets must enforce encryption using AES-256 or AWS-KMS keys.
Unencrypted S3 buckets must be auto-flagged during compliance scans.
Bucket policies should deny uploads of unencrypted objects.

awsRemediation.console: Navigate to S3 → Choose Bucket → Properties → Default Encryption → Enable AES-256 or KMS.
